column4: hello, I need help...after the default login screen, when the desktop is loading, the system is hanging, badly, the whole screen is just a solid peach colour, and a white box appears in the upper left hand corner...it looks like it wants to be a terminal there, but nothing can be typed in...help
I had that same problem
did you change the resolution?
I tried to start failsafe, same thing
mysystem was being weird before the restart
cpu was maxed out, but nothing was opened, and the system monitor would not open
how would I reset gnome?

did you just install? when you installed was the resolution 800x600 but too low? That was what happend to me. then I changed the resolution and I had your same problem. I reinstalled to get rid of it but now I still have low resolution
burepe:no
reinstalling is not really an option yet
if I can find out what is causing the system to hang...
if you find out let me know in case I have it again
sure
I think it is gnome
but I need to know how to reset gnome, in case it went haywire somehow
how would I reinstall gnome, you know, reset it to it's original settings
castoff:no, not just restart x, I mean reload gnome...reinstall it
screen just went black on said sick comp
easy enough
brb
that ubuntu desktop install takes a long time I think
